articles.title: US government takes 10 percent stake in Intel in exchange for money it was already on the hook for
articles.description: The US is investing $8.9 billion into Intel, but most of the funds come from money that the government was supposed to pay the embattled chipmaker anyway. In an announcement on Friday, Intel said the federal government will fund its investment using the remaining $5.7 billion in grants it hasn’t yet received under the Biden […]
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.content: The US is investing $8.9 billion into Intel, but most of the funds come from money that the government was supposed to pay the embattled chipmaker anyway. In an announcement on Friday, Intel said the federal government will fund its investment using the remaining $5.7 billion in grants it hasn’t yet received under the Biden […]

articles.title: FieldAI Raises $405M to Scale Embodied AI Robotics
articles.description: Backing from Bezos Expeditions, Canaan Partners, Khosla Ventures, Prysm, Temasek, and others to accelerate commercial expansion of first risk-aware foundation models for robotics FieldAI, a leader in physical AI and robotic autonomy, today announced that it has raised $405 million in two consecutive rounds. Investors include Bezos Expeditions, BHP Ventures, Canaan Partners,... The post FieldAI Raises $405M to Scale Embodied AI Robotics first appeared on AI-Tech Park.

articles.title: Google doubles down on ‘AI phones’ with its Pixel 10 series
articles.description: Google's updates to the Pixel 10 line allow it to showcase what its latest AI technology can do when enhanced by the Tensor G5 processor, an upgrade to the company's custom silicon designed for the AI experience.
articles.author: Sarah Perez
articles.content: Google's updates to the Pixel 10 line allow it to showcase what its latest AI technology can do when enhanced by the Tensor G5 processor, an upgrade to the company's custom silicon designed for the AI experience.

articles.title: Scaling domain expertise in complex, regulated domains
articles.description: Discover how Blue J is transforming tax research with AI-powered tools built on GPT-4.1. By combining domain expertise with Retrieval-Augmented Generation, Blue J delivers fast, accurate, and fully-cited tax answers—trusted by professionals across the US, Canada, and the UK.
articles.content: Discover how Blue J is transforming tax research with AI-powered tools built on GPT-4.1. By combining domain expertise with Retrieval-Augmented Generation, Blue J delivers fast, accurate, and fully-cited tax answers—trusted by professionals across the US, Canada, and the UK.

articles.title: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod enhances ML infrastructure with scalability and customizability
articles.description: In this post, we introduced three features in SageMaker HyperPod that enhance scalability and customizability for ML infrastructure. Continuous provisioning offers flexible resource provisioning to help you start training and deploying your models faster and manage your cluster more efficiently. With custom AMIs, you can align your ML environments with organizational security standards and software requirements.
articles.author: Mark Vinciguerra
articles.content: In this post, we introduced three features in SageMaker HyperPod that enhance scalability and customizability for ML infrastructure. Continuous provisioning offers flexible resource provisioning to help you start training and deploying your models faster and manage your cluster more efficiently. With custom AMIs, you can align your ML environments with organizational security standards and software requirements.

articles.title: Cornell  researchers build first ‘microwave brain’ on a chip
articles.description: Cornell engineers have built the first fully integrated “microwave brain” — a silicon microchip that can process ultrafast data and wireless signals at the same time, while using less than 200 milliwatts of power. Instead of digital steps, it uses analog microwave physics for real-time computations like radar tracking, signal decoding, and anomaly detection. This unique neural network design bypasses traditional processing bottlenecks, achieving high accuracy without the extra circuitry or...
articles.content: Cornell engineers have built the first fully integrated “microwave brain” — a silicon microchip that can process ultrafast data and wireless signals at the same time, while using less than 200 milliwatts of power. Instead of digital steps, it uses analog microwave physics for real-time computations like radar tracking, signal decoding, and anomaly detection. This unique neural network design bypasses traditional processing bottlenecks, achieving high accuracy without the extra circuitry or...

articles.title: Amazon builds first foundation model for multirobot coordination
articles.description: Trained on millions of hours of data from Amazon fulfillment centers and sortation centers, Amazon’s new DeepFleet models predict future traffic patterns for fleets of mobile robots.
articles.author: Joey Durham
articles.content: Trained on millions of hours of data from Amazon fulfillment centers and sortation centers, Amazon’s new DeepFleet models predict future traffic patterns for fleets of mobile robots.

articles.title: Beta-HPV can directly cause skin cancer in immunocompromised people
articles.description: NIH case study finds virus drives creation of cancer cells in context of defective T cells.
articles.content: NIH case study finds virus drives creation of cancer cells in context of defective T cells.

articles.title: ‘Shut it down and start again’: staff disquiet as Alan Turing Institute faces identity crisis
articles.description: Whistleblower warns UK’s top AI research body in danger of collapse due to threats over funding and new directionWhen the UK government announced the creation of the Alan Turing Institute in 2014 it promised a “fitting memorial” to the renowned computer scientist and artificial intelligence pioneer.More than a decade on, Britain’s leading AI institute is in turmoil as staff warn it may be in danger of collapse and ministers demand a shift in focus to defence and security work. Continue...
articles.author: Dan Milmo Global technology editor

articles.title: How to reduce alert overload in defence SOCs
articles.description: Analysts face a relentless flood of notifications with the majority turning out to be false positives. Studies show that 71% of security operations center (SOC) personnel1 experience burnout and report feeling overwhelmed by alert volume. One of the top frustrations among analysts is that they’re spending too much time handling false positives and performing manual work. Most concerning of all, a 2024 survey2 shows a staggering 62% of alerts are entirely ignored, and accuracy drops by 40% after...
articles.author: Crossley McEwen
articles.content: Analysts face a relentless flood of notifications with the majority turning out to be false positives. Studies show that 71% of security operations center (SOC) personnel1 experience burnout and report feeling overwhelmed by alert volume. One of the top frustrations among analysts is that they’re spending too much time handling false positives and performing manual work. Most concerning of all, a 2024 survey2 shows a staggering 62% of alerts are entirely ignored, and accuracy drops by 40% after...

articles.title: Elastic joins AWS Zero Trust Accelerator for Government (ZTAG) program
articles.description: Elastic is proud to be officially recognized as an AWS Zero Trust for Government partner and for onboarding into the AWS Zero Trust Accelerator for Government (ZTAG) program in the US. By integrating Elastic’s data-centric approach with AWS’s Zero trust framework, this partnership empowers US federal agencies to accelerate and operationalize their Zero Trust adoption efforts.The release and timing of any features or functionality described in this post remain at Elastic's sole discretion. Any...

articles.title: How Leaders Are Using RL to Build a Competitive AI Advantage
articles.description: I have long been fascinated by reinforcement learning (RL), but have always viewed it as complex and beyond the reach of most enterprise AI teams.
